title: Drawing, 1938-88-1896
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A molded oblong upon a molded base. In the center, on top, are a pair of scales, a military flail, fasces surrounded by a wreath, and below a prelate's hat. Hanging garlands springing from cornucopias, laterally. Indication of an inscription inside. Colored background.
